meanings.definition: An organism or machine that reproduces or copies itself.
meanings.sent1: The replicators in the pond multiplied quickly.
meanings.sent2: The 3D printer is a replicators that can make identical models.
meanings.sent3: The replicators at the factory were having a race to see who could make the most copies.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like replicators, spreading rapidly throughout the team.
meanings.sent5: The replicators in the sci-fi movie were unstoppable, creating endless copies of themselves.

meanings.definition: A device or system that creates exact copies of data or objects.
meanings.sent1: The replicators in the office made it easy to duplicate important documents.
meanings.sent2: The CD burner is a replicators that can make multiple copies of music.
meanings.sent3: The replicators in the library were working overtime to replicate all the books.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a replicators, storing every detail perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The replicators in the lab were so precise, they could replicate even the tiniest components.

meanings.sent1: The virus acted as a replicators, spreading from one computer to another.
meanings.sent2: The mold in the kitchen was a replicators, growing rapidly and covering everything.
meanings.sent3: The replicators of gossip were working overtime in the school.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was a replicators, contagious and spreading to everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The replicators of kindness in the community made everyone feel welcomed and appreciated.
